example.name: auxiliary
example.text: John has annoyed Mary for the last time.

example.name: modal
example.text: John has to apologize to Mary.

example.name: bummer
example.text: Four of the five surviving workers have asbestos-related diseases, including three with recently diagnosed cancer.
example.arg: Four of the five surviving workers
including three with recently diagnosed cancer

example.name: Miracle of Life Sense
example.text: Some of them had children while they were out at sea.
example.arg: while they were out at sea

roleset.name: have yet to

role.descr: subject, entity having not yet done arg2
have yet to what (infinitival S-node complement)

example.name: all args
example.text: [US News]-1 has yet *-1 to announce its 1990 ad rates.

example.name: all args
example.text: We did experience some difficulties with the initial LBO terms and , as your article made clear , successfully restructured our debt earlier this year , something those other retailers have yet to accomplish .

example.name: passive infinitival complement. same args.
example.text: [Some of the biggest service - industry exporters -- American financial - service companies , for example --]-1 have yet [*-1]-2 to be fully included *-2 in our export statistics .
example.arg: Some of the biggest service - industry exporters -- American financial - service companies , for example --
[*-1]-2 to be fully included *-2 in our export statistics .

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on ontonotes-miss instances. No VNcls.

roleset.name: semi-modal: had better/best

role.descr: what arg0 had better/best do (main verb clause)

roles.note: This is another modal variant. This time we're including args. Please use them!

example.name: Had best. Also, good advice.
example.text: One-1 had best *-1 not dance on top of a coffin until the lid is sealed tightly shut . ''
example.arg: *-1 not dance on top of a coffin until the lid is sealed tightly shut .
example.note: (the 'not' is part of the main verb clause in this tree, so it's not in the taggable span)

example.name: had better
example.text: He-1 had better *-1 do what he is told.

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on ontonotes-miss instances. No VNcls.

roleset.name: have at you! (tackle)

example.name: Standard usage
example.text: But , if you just got your arms and legs blown off by and IED , then by all means , have at it . -LRB- Err ... have someone do it for you . -RRB-
example.arg: if you just got your arms and legs blown off by and IED

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on BOLT

roleset.name: have_one's_way_with: have sex with, possibly rape-ily

example.name: all args
example.text: It 's rather amusing to watch them shove Obama down people 's throats every night on the news , while completely *PRO* having their way with Hillary .

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on BOLT. No VNcls.

predicate.note: Frames file for 'have' based on sentences in wsj. No Verbnet entry.

roleset.name: have a go at; attempt, try out
roleset.note: Added by Julia based on BOLT. No VNcls.

example.name: Both args
example.text: When I first looked last month I had a go at photographing the planet and managed to get four of the moons :
example.note: Treebank is at this point consitently putting 'a go at __' into the same taggable parent node. If this ever stops being the case, we'll probably need to concatenate.
example.arg: When I first looked last month
a go at photographing the planet

frameset.note: With any luck the annotators will see a minimum of the auxiliary and modal usages.
